purpose: The email announces the availability of Postdoctoral Fellow and Research Fellow positions at the Helsinki Institute for Information Technology (HIIT). It details the duration of the positions, which can be up to three years for Postdoctoral Fellows and up to five years for Research Fellows, with negotiable starting and ending dates. The email emphasizes the commitment of Aalto University and the University of Helsinki to inclusivity and encourages applications from underrepresented groups. It also outlines the strategic focus areas for candidates, including Artificial Intelligence, Computational Health, Cybersecurity, Data Science, and Foundations of Computing. Additionally, it provides specific topics for software engineering applicants and suggests contacting principal investigators (PIs) before applying.

evidence_sentences: The Helsinki Institute for Information Technology (HIIT) invites applications for Postdoctoral Fellows and Research Fellows.
HIIT offers a HIIT Postdoctoral Fellow position for up to three years.
For more senior candidates, HIIT offers a HIIT Research Fellow position for up to five years.

Aalto University and the University of Helsinki are both committed to fostering an inclusive environment with people from diverse backgrounds, and researchers from underrepresented groups are particularly encouraged to apply.
All excellent researchers in any area of ICT can be considered, but priority is given to candidates who support one (or more) of the HIIT strategic focus areas.

Software engineering applicants can find suitable topics under PIs listed in Data Science such as: Fabian Fagerholm: Human Factors in Software Engineering, Developer Experience, Affect in Software Engineering.
Contacting the PIs before applying is advisable but not mandatory.
